text: Samantha Reed Smith (June 29, 1972 - August 25, 1985) was an American schoolgirl, peace activist, and child actress. She became famous during the Cold War between the United States and the Soviet Union. In 1982, Smith wrote a letter to Soviet Leader Yuri Andropov, and received a personal reply with a personal invitation to visit the Soviet Union, which she accepted. Smith became a "Goodwill Ambassador" between the U.S. and the Soviet Union, becoming America's Youngest Ambassador. Smith died on August 25, 1985 in the Bar Harbor Airlines Flight 1808 plane crash near Auburn, Maine at the age of 13. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:1985 deaths Category:American child actors Category:American political activists Category:Actors from Maine Category:Writers from Maine Category:Aviation deaths in the United States
